p: Table 1 summarizes the statistic characteristics in hot seasons (May–September) in Wuhan, China during 2003–2010. A total of 11,824 non-accidental deaths occurred during the study period, including 5237 (44.3%) females and 8562 (72.4%) people over 65 years old. The average daily mean temperature was 26.7 °C (range from 12.7 to 35.8 °C), the average daily maximum temperature was 30.9 °C (range from 18.9 to 39.6 °C), and the average daily relative humidity was 71.4% (range from 37 to 96%). The average daily concentration of air pollutants were 90.5 ± 44.0 μg/m 3, 35.4 ± 19.7 μg/m 3, and 46.4 ± 18.9 μg/m 3 for PM 10, SO 2, and NO 2, respectively.
